title: States Push New Laws Targeting AI 'Surveillance Pricing'
author: Skift
description: Regulatory backlash against AI-driven dynamic pricing. States are pushing legislation that could impact how hotels use AI for personalized pricing.

title: Marriott Advances Technology Migration as AI Strategy Moves Into Deployment
author: Dustin Stone
description: Covers Marriott's technology migration and deployment of AI strategy across operations, including cloud migration and AI-driven tools for property management.

title: Chesky Disses Rivals' Chatbots — Calls Airbnb's AI 'Impossible to Replicate'
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky defends his company's slower AI rollout, calling its 'intentional path' toward a native AI platform 'our strongest defense against disintermediation.'

title: Expedia's B2B Surge Buys Time for Vrbo and Hotels.com
author: Skift
description: Expedia's B2B division is growing 5x faster than its consumer brands, buying time as Vrbo and Hotels.com evolve under the One Key strategy.

title: Hyatt CEO Sees Lift From AI Search; Reveals ChatGPT App
author: Skift
description: Hyatt CEO reveals two years of AI enablement, a rebuilt website search reflecting conversational trip planning, improved booking conversion rates, and a new ChatGPT integration.

title: Tripadvisor Sees Traffic Decline from AI Overviews, Considers 'Strategic Alternatives'
author: Skift
description: Tripadvisor CEO cited 'ongoing declines in flyby visitors' due to AI Overviews. SEO expected to generate less than 10% of the Experience business's GBV by end of 2026.

title: New Marriott and Hilton Filings Reveal Risks From AI Platforms to Direct Bookings
author: Sean O'Neill
description: Hilton and Marriott flagged AI platforms like ChatGPT as threats to direct bookings in their SEC filings — the first time either company formally identified LLMs as a distribution risk.

title: Marriott Says Google AI Mode Will Process Hotel Bookings, Not Just Send Links
author: Adriana Lee
description: Marriott CEO Anthony Capuano reveals the hotel giant is building an integration to process bookings directly through Google's AI Mode, offering the first public look at how agentic travel booking will function.

title: Hilton CEO: 2026 'Will Be a Lot Better Than 25' After Results Show Sluggish Growth
author: Sean O'Neill
description: Hilton's 2025 results showed muted RevPAR growth reflecting economic strain on mid-market travelers. CEO Chris Nassetta discusses Hilton's leverage over AI platforms.

title: Marriott Plans New Credit-Card Deals, Sees Surge in Fee Revenue
author: Sean O'Neill
description: Marriott expects 'around a 35% increase' in co-branded credit-card fees in 2026, driven by higher issuer royalties and continued growth in cardholder spending.

title: OpenAI Launches Ads Pilot for ChatGPT, Travel Expected to Participate
author: Adriana Lee
description: OpenAI began testing ads inside ChatGPT, inserting sponsored content into one of the most visible trip-planning tools. A new commercial access point to travelers at the moment of planning.

title: Google Earnings: AI Search Is Changing Travel Discovery
author: Adriana Lee
description: Google's Q4 earnings call made clear the company is moving from building AI infrastructure to deploying it. CEO Sundar Pichai framed 2026 as 'the year where you will see consumers actually being able to use all of this.'

title: Google's Latest AI Search Features Look Like a Personalized Travel Concierge
author: Adriana Lee
description: Google announced AI updates coalescing into a revamped search experience — more conversational and personalized. Gemini 3 powers AI Overviews, while AI Mode taps into private data.

title: Accor Launches App in ChatGPT to Compete for Early Bookings
author: Luke Martin
description: Accor launched a branded app inside ChatGPT's app store, marking an early move by a hotel group into OpenAI's in-chat ecosystem.

title: Navan Buys Lodging Visibility With Booking.com as the Guide
author: Clara Awuse
description: Navan expanded its direct connection with Booking.com to give corporate travelers access to wider lodging options and discounted rates.

title: From Vibe Coding to Exclusive LLM Deals: AI Takeaways from Agoda's CEO
author: Skift
description: Agoda CEO discusses AI workflows and exclusive LLM deals — showing how OTAs are adapting their technology strategy for the AI era.

title: Skift Megatrends Debate: How Fast Will AI Disrupt Travel?
author: Adriana Lee
description: At the Skift Megatrends event, experts debated how quickly AI will reshape travel distribution. They agreed on direction but disagreed on timing.

title: Mews Raises $300 Million to Prove AI Can Run Hotel Operations
author: Adriana Lee
description: Hotel technology company Mews raised $300 million at a $2.5 billion valuation to build AI agents that autonomously manage hotel operations.

title: Google's Advice for Travel Brands: Forget Generic Keywords, AI Can Read Your Photos
author: Adriana Lee
description: Google's industry head for travel spoke about how travelers use conversational AI for planning but revert to traditional search when ready to convert.

title: Airbnb Builds Hotel Team to Take On the OTAs
author: Skift
description: Airbnb elevated Jesse Stein to head of hotels and hired Lou Zameryka from Booking.com. Chesky: 'We Are Now Getting Serious About Hotels.'

title: The Rebalancing of Travel and Decline of Brand Loyalty
author: Varsha Arora
description: 53% of U.S. travelers would switch brands if AI tools surfaced better deals. Introduces the 'Travel Confidence Index' blending intent, trip volume, and spending outlook.

title: Travel's Wallet Share Reckoning Is Here
author: Rafat Ali
description: Three independent signals from U.S. credit card issuers point to the same pressure: travel is losing wallet share. The post-pandemic spending binge is over.

title: Credit-Card Rewards Now Rival Airline and Hotel Loyalty Programs
author: Sean O'Neill
description: 34% of U.S. travelers say credit-card programs offer the most rewarding benefits, compared to 22% for hotel programs and 21% for airlines.

title: Skift + McKinsey: Remapping Travel With Agentic AI
author: Skift Research & McKinsey
description: Comprehensive research report on agentic AI implications for travel, examining how AI agents will reshape distribution, booking, and the travel value chain.

title: MCP Explained: The AI Standard Reshaping Travel Tech
author: Adriana Lee
description: Explains Model Context Protocol (MCP), the AI standard that streamlines how travel systems are made accessible to AI agents. Not being machine-readable will mean becoming invisible.

title: Online Travel Is Set for Growth, But AI Threatens the Status Quo
author: Saniya Zanpure
description: The global OTA market generated $94 billion in revenue in 2024. Skift Research expects $107 billion by 2026. But OTAs face a major shift if AI platforms bypass them altogether.

title: Why Travel's Biggest Brands Are Becoming Dangerously Boring
author: Colin Nagy
description: A branding critique arguing that some travel brands are making the same mistakes luxury fashion spent millions learning to regret — identities that are calm, neutral, and lack personality.

title: Data Centers Are Rewriting the Hotel Development Map
author: Rafat Ali
description: An infrastructure supercycle driven by data centers and AI is reshaping hotel development. Some of the next best hotel markets will look like 'non-destinations.'

title: The Ugly New Math Crushing Hotels
author: Sean O'Neill
description: U.S. hotels are spending more to operate while taking in less revenue. Labor costs soared 9% year-over-year on a per-available-room basis.

title: Google's Latest Test Could Erode Travel Search Referrals Even More
author: Adriana Lee
description: Google began testing a feature that lets users jump from AI Overviews directly into AI Mode on mobile, keeping users inside the results page.

title: Cracks Emerge in the Online Travel Agency Oligopoly
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Booking Holdings, Expedia, Airbnb, and Trip.com control roughly two-thirds of global gross bookings, but their grip is loosening as AI platforms and hotel direct channels grow.

title: Q&A: Accommodation Curation Will Change the Loyalty Landscape
author: Skift
description: Discusses how curation-based loyalty is replacing points-based loyalty, representing a fundamental shift in how travelers engage with hotel programs.

title: The Great Reinvention of Hotel Loyalty
author: Robin Gilbert-Jones
description: Hotel loyalty is evolving from a points program into a personalized, experience-led, AI-powered ecosystem. Brands that embrace the shift will unlock deeper engagement and stronger direct bookings.

title: Aviation's New Third Rail: AI Pricing
author: Skift
description: Examines AI "surveillance pricing" fears in aviation — relevant to the ethical debate around hotel dynamic pricing.

title: More Clarity, More Experiences: What's Next for Hotel Loyalty
author: Sean O'Neill
description: Hotel loyalty programs are in the middle of their biggest shift in years — greater transparency, more experiential moments, and deeper digital integration.

title: Google Clarifies Its Agentic AI Booking Plans: 'No Intention of Becoming an OTA'
author: Adriana Lee
description: Google stressed it has 'no intention of becoming an OTA' as it develops its agentic AI booking tool with partners including Booking.com, Expedia, Marriott, and others.

title: Hilton Overhauls Loyalty Program: Adds Top Tier, Lowers Bar for Status
author: Sean O'Neill
description: Hilton made it easier to earn elite status while creating a new top tier for its biggest spenders, the latest move in an escalating competition among hotel chains.

title: Google Is Building Agentic Travel Booking
author: Adriana Lee
description: Google unveiled an agentic tool for booking flights and hotels, aiming to turn AI Mode into a travel hub that can plan trips and help users complete them.

title: 1 Hotels Loyalty Revamp: Green Giving, Not Free Rooms
author: Sean O'Neill
description: Barry Sternlicht's 1 Hotels ditched points for tree-planting and charity donations, betting eco-conscious guests value impact over free stays.

title: How Airbnb Is Thinking About Its Third New Business — Hotels
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Airbnb is running a hotel pilot in New York City, Los Angeles, and Madrid — cities with tough short-term rental restrictions.

title: This Marriott Metric Points to Profit Pressure
author: Pranavi Agarwal
description: Marriott's flat incentive management fees signal profit pressures at the property level — a barometer of the industry's underlying financial health.

title: Wyndham's $95 Loyalty Program: Can Hotels Make Subscriptions Work?
author: Sean O'Neill
description: Wyndham wants travelers to pay $95/year for hotel discounts and loyalty perks — the first major experiment in a paid loyalty program by a U.S.-based hotel group.

title: The New Science of Hotel Pricing
author: Sean O'Neill
description: The $340 billion U.S. hotel industry is replacing gut instinct with precision pricing. Less than 10% of independent hotels use advanced pricing tech.

title: Airbnb Needs to Win Over Policymakers — the Cost Is Adding Up
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Airbnb acknowledged for the first time that lobbying spend to win over policymakers will contribute to lower profit margins.

title: Where Hotels Can Find Growth: Live Events, Social Commerce, Smarter Loyalty
author: Robin Gilbert-Jones
description: Identifies social commerce as a $2 billion opportunity for hotels, alongside live events and loyalty reinvention as growth drivers.

title: Expedia Makes Gains as Google Hotels Is Increasingly 'Bruised'
author: Dennis Schaal
description: With Google Hotels under pressure from the EU's Digital Markets Act and its own AI Overviews, Expedia, Tripadvisor, and newcomer Super.com are making gains.

title: Tripadvisor's Perplexity Deal: AI for Customer Acquisition Is Now a Thing in Travel
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Tripadvisor's partnership with Perplexity represents the emergence of AI customer acquisition channels in travel, potentially redirecting marketing spend away from Google.

title: Hotelbeds' Parent Plans to IPO at a $5.1 Billion Valuation
author: Skift
description: HBX Group, the world's largest hotel wholesaler, planned an IPO at $5.1 billion valuation. Distributes to 60,000 OTAs, agencies, tour operators, airlines, and loyalty programs.

title: AI Overviews Impact on Search Traffic
author: Authoritas
description: Research measuring the impact of Google's AI Overviews on organic search traffic and referrals, relevant to understanding how AI is reshaping travel search.

title: Hotel Loyalty Programs Continue to Prove Their Value: Key Findings from 675 Million Members
author: CBRE
description: Loyalty fees increased 4.4% in 2024, outpacing 2.7% revenue growth. CPOR for loyalty at $5.46 (1.6% of revenue). 675M members across major brands. Loyalty members = ~50% of room nights at major chains.

title: Hotel Versus OTA Direct-Booking Tussle Will Shape Distribution for Years
author: Dennis Schaal
description: OTAs held $266 billion vs hotel websites' $262 billion in gross bookings — a narrowing gap. Examines whether hotel websites will become the dominant channel by 2030.

title: Will Hotel Direct Bookings Overtake OTAs? Digging Deeper Into Our Forecast
author: Pranavi Agarwal, Seth Borko
description: Examining whether direct digital channels will generate more than $400 billion in hotel gross bookings by 2030 versus $333 billion from OTAs.

title: The Ideal Mix For Hotel Distribution: Direct Bookings to Lead by 2030
author: Pranavi Agarwal
description: Skift Research predicts direct digital channels will overtake OTAs as the dominant distribution channel by 2030, generating over $400 billion in global hotel gross bookings.

title: Tripadvisor CEO on Evolution From Advertising to a Booking Model
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Tripadvisor CEO Matt Goldberg discusses the shift from metasearch and advertising clicks to generative AI trip-planning and 'engagement economics.'

title: Banned in NYC: Airbnb One Year Later
author: Dennis Schaal
description: An in-depth look at the impact of NYC's Local Law 18 one year later. Hotels are thriving, but small-time hosts lost a key income source.

title: Tripadvisor's Flagship Brand Saw Revenue Decline Accelerate With Google Search Changes a Factor
author: Justin Dawes
description: Revenue for Tripadvisor's flagship brand declined 10% year-over-year in Q2, accelerating from a 2% decline in Q1. Executives attributed the decline to ongoing metasearch pressure and changes in Google's travel search results pages.

title: Selina Collapses in Liquidity Crisis, Seeks Buyers
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Selina, the hospitality brand targeting digital nomads, collapsed amid a liquidity crisis — a cautionary tale in alternative accommodation models.

title: The Latest Numbers Behind Hotel Groups' Bet on Credit Card Rewards
author: Sean O'Neill
description: CBRE analysis of five major U.S. hotel groups (Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt, Choice, Wyndham) shows loyalty programs drive occupancy growth. Loyalty members accounted for one out of every two room nights at major chains.

title: How Travel Metasearch Lost Its Mojo
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Travel metasearch companies used to be the hottest thing in travel, but Google Hotels, YouTube, TikTok, and loyalty programs have deflated the value proposition.

title: HOTREC European Hotel Distribution Study 2022
author: HOTREC
description: Comprehensive study of European hotel distribution channels, including OTA share, direct booking trends, and the impact of rate parity regulations across European markets.

title: Google Free Booking Links: One Year Later
author: Google
description: Follow-up on the impact of free booking links one year after launch, with data on adoption and performance.

title: A New Way for Hotels to Reach Travelers with Free Booking Links
author: Google
description: Google's original announcement of free booking links for hotels, enabling properties to appear in Google Hotels results without ad spend.

title: The State of Online Retail Performance
author: Akamai Technologies
description: Research on how website performance (page load speed) impacts conversion rates and revenue in online retail, applied to hotel direct booking optimization.

title: Hotel CEOs Think Their Direct Booking Pushes Position Them for Long-Term Gain
author: Deanna Ting
description: Hotel CEOs defend their direct booking campaigns as long-term strategic investments rather than short-term marketing stunts.

title: Hilton's New Ad Campaign and the Push for More Direct Hotel Bookings
author: Dennis Schaal
description: Coverage of Hilton's "Stop Clicking Around" campaign launch, one of the opening salvos in the hotel industry's direct booking wars against OTAs.

title: Hilton's Stop Clicking Around Campaign
author: Reuters
description: Coverage of Hilton's landmark "Stop Clicking Around" direct booking campaign that helped spark the industry-wide direct booking wars between hotels and OTAs.
